title.narrative: Institutional support to Roma Union in Albania

description.narrative: The project aims to strengthen AmaroDrom and provide business-oriented services and advocacy aimed at social inclusion of Roma communities and their economic empowerment. Expected results are - Improved capacity of AmaroDrom organisation to lobby and advocate on local, national and regional level; - AmaroDrom’s capacity in business development and project management are enhanced; - Project Management skills are enhanced; - Amarodrom is recognised as active promotor of participatory community development; - Awareness is raised on business opportunities and income generation from agriculture activities; - Business planning and management skills among target groups improved; - Capacity building programme in innovative agriculture crops and technologies implemented; - Capacity and skills of participating communities in off-farm business opportunities are improved; - Improved access to civic rights and economic opportunities for Roma and other minorities; - Lobbying, advocacy and networking at the national level enhanced.

"• Amarodrom is strengthening the networking between the Roma and Egyptian organisations in Albania. In the moment, more than 18 organisations are part of the network, leaded by Amarodrom. Member organisations have continuous capacity building for lobby and advocacy. As a result of these activities, 2 initiatives were undertaken from the network to lobby for justice and to improve socio-economic situation of Roma families. • Amarodrom increased the number of Roma farmers who cultivate their land, instead of renting it. Roma community have increased capacity and information for financial services and support for cultivation of their land. • Amarodrom increased the number of members in the organisation for 2518 members, from which 50% are women. Amarodrom employees have increased their capacities for project management and monitoring. • 20 Young Roma are in process to complete VET course • 2 farmers clubs were created during 2018, from which 50% are women members. "

activity-date.narrative: Planned end date of the activity
Planned start date of the activity
